meanings.definition: The act or process of breaking or causing something to break into small parts or pieces.
meanings.sent1: The fragmentation of the glass was loud and sudden.
meanings.sent2: The fragmentation of the cake made it easy to share with everyone.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick involved the fragmentation of a single playing card into confetti.
meanings.sent4: The fragmentation of the once united group led to chaos and confusion.
meanings.sent5: The fragmentation of the rock created a beautiful mosaic of colors.

meanings.definition: The state of being broken into small parts or pieces.
meanings.sent1: After the explosion, the fragmentation of the building left debris everywhere.
meanings.sent2: The fragmentation of the market led to increased competition among smaller companies.
meanings.sent3: The artist's sculpture showcased the beauty of fragmentation in nature.
meanings.sent4: The fragmentation of the puzzle made it challenging to put back together.
meanings.sent5: The fragmentation of the melody into individual notes added depth to the music.
